article.headline: S. Dakota 75, Chicago St. 71
article.story: CHICAGO -- Louie Krogman scored 23 points and Charlie Westbrook 21, and South Dakota held off a late surge by Chicago State to win 75-71 Thursday night. Krogman made 5 of 10 3-pointers, though his teammates went only 4-for-21, as the Coyotes (12-11, 4-2 Great West) notched their first road victory. Carl Montgomery had a double-double of 22 points and 13 rebounds for the Cougars (6-19, 3-5), who have lost five of six. Jonathon Montgomery added 19 points, including 5 3-pointers, and Hajji Martin scored 11. South Dakota pushed its lead to 64-52 on Mitchell Bouie's basket with 8:39 left. Chicago State still trailed by eight with 2:22 to go, but Jonathon Montgomery and Martin hit back-to-back 3-pointers to cut it to 73-71 with 1:11 left. But the Cougars missed two shots in the final 15 seconds, and Trevor Gruis and Jake Thomas hit free throws for the Coyotes.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
